meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else for entertainment or fraud.
meanings.sent1: The impersonator at the party did a great job mimicking famous actors.
meanings.sent2: The talented impersonator entertained the audience with his spot-on impressions.
meanings.sent3: The impersonator at the comedy show had everyone fooled with his hilarious celebrity imitations.
meanings.sent4: She was like a chameleon, transforming into different characters effortlessly as an impersonator.
meanings.sent5: The impersonator's performance was so convincing that some audience members thought they were seeing the real celebrities.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor had to impersonate a famous historical figure.
meanings.sent2: He decided to impersonate his favorite superhero for the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The child loved to impersonate their favorite cartoon character around the house.
meanings.sent4: She could impersonate her teacher's voice so well that even the principal was fooled.
meanings.sent5: Impersonating a police officer is illegal and can lead to serious consequences.
